thread.title: High school football: Vikings shut out Silverwolves 38-0 in Region 4 play
thread.title_full: High school football: Vikings shut out Silverwolves 38-0 in Region 4 play | Deseret News

title: High school football: Vikings shut out Silverwolves 38-0 in Region 4 play
text:
Not since Aug. 31, 2012, had Riverton been shut out before Pleasant Grove's 38-0 win Friday night.
More Coverage High school football: T-Birds turn back Chargers, all but clinch Region 7 crown High school football roundup for Friday, Oct. 9 “ Our defense was phenomenal. We knew Riverton was good defensively, but our defensive coaches did a great job getting our guys prepared. Our linebackers were all over the place. Our linemen created turnovers and got our offense the ball in good situations.”
Pleasant Grove head coach Les Hamilton
RIVERTON — Pleasant Grove's defense came out in spades Friday night as the Vikings shut out the Riverton Silverwolves 38-0 in this Region 4 game.
Pleasant Grove's defense was the shining star. In the first quarter, there were seven punts. Four of those punts belonged to Riverton. One of those four punt returns was by speedy and efficient Malik Overstreet for a 43-yard score.
The Vikings ended the quarter up 7-0.
The second quarter was more of the same as the Viking defense forced two more Riverton punts and intercepted a Riverton pass. The interception resulted in a 48-yard field goal by Pleasant Grove kicker senior Matt Smyth.
At the 3:36 mark in the second period, senior running back Koy Wilkinson scored the first of his three touchdowns. The end of the first half, Pleasant Grove was leading Riverton 17-0.
"Our defense was phenomenal," Pleasant Grove head coach Les Hamilton said. "We knew Riverton was good defensively, but our defensive coaches did a great job getting our guys prepared. Our linebackers were all over the place. Our linemen created turnovers and got our offense the ball in good situations."
A the 6:53 mark of the third quarter, Pleasant Grove's Wilkinson scored his second touchdown on a 3-yard scramble up the middle. Just before the end of the third quarter, Viking freshman Dane Christiansen took the handoff from senior quarterback Isaac Hamilton and ran left then cut back, reached the far sideline and sprinted up the outside line for 76 yards and a second touchdown in the third period.
Wrapping up the scoring was Wilkinson with his third score of the game with a 3-yard push in the middle of the line. With all these touchdowns, senior place-kicker Smyth scored all five PATs for the game.
Riverton was last shut out in August 2012 with a 24-0 setback to Syracuse.
For the game, Riverton had 47 carries for 139 yards rushing and completed 3-of-10 passes for a total of 34 passing yards making a total of 173 offensive yards, with eight first downs.
Pleasant Grove had 32 carries for 187 yards rushing and completed 15-of-30 passes for 169 yards making 356 total offensive yards with 15 first downs. Pleasant Grove's Wilkinson had 21 carries for 96 yards and three touchdowns. Christiansen had two carries for 87 yards and one long touchdown run of 76 yards.
Riverton now has a Region 4 record of 0-5 and 1-7 overall. The Silverwolves will continue playing on the road at American Fork High School.
Pleasant Grove will stay home for the next region challenge against Westlake High School.
Kent Allen lives in Pleasant Grove and reports on Pleasant Grove High School varsity sports for Deseret Connect.
